chapter.title: &ceph; cluster administration
chapter.para: This chapter introduces tasks that are performed on the whole cluster.

sect1.title: Shutting down and restarting the whole cluster
sect1.para: To shut down the whole &ceph; cluster for planned maintenance tasks, follow these steps:

step.para: Stop all clients that are using the cluster.
Verify that the cluster is in a healthy state. Use the following commands:

step.screen: &prompt.cephuser;ceph osd set noout &prompt.cephuser;ceph osd set nobackfill &prompt.cephuser;ceph osd set norecover

tip.para: In addition, you can pause the cluster. When the cluster is paused, you cannot see when OSDs come back up again and no &crushmap; updates will happen. To pause the cluster, set the following flags:
tip.screen: &prompt.cephuser;ceph osd set norebalance &prompt.cephuser;ceph osd set nodown &prompt.cephuser;ceph osd set pause

step.para: Shutdown service nodes one by one (non-storage workers).
Shutdown &mon; nodes one by one (masters by default).

sect1.para: After you finish the maintenance, you can start the cluster again by running the above procedure in reverse order.
